page.title: 09Pebworth Church Bells
page.content: An appeal began in l984 to restore the 5 bells of St. Peter's Church, Pebworth and to add a 6th bell to complete the peal. The Â£l7,000 needed to refurbish them and to replace the wooden ringing frame with a metal one, is being raised by covenants, donations, grants and village events. The bells, weighing 2 tons, were lowered from the tower by volunteers and put on show in the church for the lst time in 300 years. A 6th bell was purchased and taken with the others to Oxford for refurbishing and tuning. The belfry floor will be strengthened to support the new bell frame. The church clock has, meanwhile, been stopped. A team of young ringers will be ready to ring the full peal in l986.
